intro: Haemacanthus coccineus, commonly known as the red hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its striking red or pink flowers, which bloom in clusters and attract pollinators such as bees and birds. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other hibiscus species. Its botanical features make it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and landscapes.
